question.post: What are the political implications of millions of Japanese men dropping out of society?
replies: >>449787526The implication is that white Americans like myself have and will move here and make a better life than these Japanese men could ever do. I like Japanese, including the guys but they basically fall into four categories. Wage slave normie cuck, withdraw otaku who never engaged with peers or bettered themself, chad who is too busy hanging out with male friends to find a mate, and feminine guy that probably actually gets more girls than the other three. When I first came here I had no interest in Japanese girls but after years of them just throwing themselves at me because ninety percent of dudes are one of the four types I slowly succumbed to appreciating the women and I am now married with multiple kids with a pretty good job a d a bright future. Not sure why the indigenous men cannot make a good life in this society but I think there is something wrong with the way they operate on a social level.
>>449787913Why did you initially go to Japan? How long did it take you to learn the language enough to communicate effectively?

>>449788038I was a journalist and I originally went because I was assigned here.>>449788473I don’t think I’m so bad. I never wanted to take advantage of the easy women here and now that I am married with kids I turn down tons of advances. I think that I actually am quite a good Japanese citizen by staying and marrying the woman I knocked up and then creating a family with her.The point I want to get across is that unlike a lot of western countries in which the media and other factors are to blame for the state of society, here in Japan it is almost exclusively the men who are to blame. They became weak, feminine, and the few that are strong just become wage slaves because they have no spine or else ignore women and just spend their time hanging with bros. Japan is one of the few countries in the world where a man can still be conservative and traditional and make something of himself and yet the men here would rather just be a bunch of losers

Other than the otaku they all seem interesting in just projecting something instead of simply existing as a real person. Very few Japanese in my experience seem to be genuine, women and men. For women that’s mostly okay because they just act and look cute but for guys they just become this weird hollow shell that lives life vapidly and does not seek out any substance which is probably why the have a declining birth rate. Thank god for the wagecucks I guess but I feel bad for them.
